member.name: T:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient
member.summary: A common interface implementation that is implemented by most cache providers

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to delete.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully removed from the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.RemoveAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Removes the cache for all the keys provided.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The retrieved item, or null if the key was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server. A non existent value at key starts at 0
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to increase the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server. A non existent value at key starts at 0
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to decrease the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Add``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Adds a new item into the cache at the specified cache key only if the cache is empty.
member.param: The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Set``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sets an item into the cache at the cache key specified regardless if it already exists or not.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.Replace``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Replaces the item at the cachekey specified only if an items exists at the location already.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.FlushAll
member.summary: Invalidates all data on the cache.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.GetAll``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Retrieves multiple items from the cache. The default value of T is set for all keys that do not exist.
member.param: The list of identifiers for the items to retrieve.
member.returns: a Dictionary holding all items indexed by their key.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.ICacheClient.SetAll``1(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Sets multiple items to the cache.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IRemoveByPattern.RemoveByPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Removes items from cache that have keys matching the specified wildcard pattern
member.param: The wildcard, where "*" means any sequence of characters and "?" means any single character.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IRemoveByPattern.RemoveByRegex(System.String)
member.summary: Removes items from the cache based on the specified regular expression pattern
member.param: Regular expression pattern to search cache keys

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient
member.summary:
A light interface over a cache client. This interface was inspired by Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient
Only the methods that are intended to be used are required, if you require extra functionality you can uncomment the unused methods below as they have been implemented in DdnMemcachedClient

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to delete.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully removed from the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.RemoveAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Removes the cache for all the keys provided.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The retrieved item, or null if the key was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to increase the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to decrease the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The time when the item is invalidated in the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.FlushAll
member.summary: Removes all data from the cache.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Caching.IMemcachedClient.GetAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Retrieves multiple items from the cache.
member.param: The list of identifiers for the items to retrieve.
member.returns: a Dictionary holding all items indexed by their key.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiAllowableValuesAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets parameter name with which allowable values will be associated.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiAttribute.Description
member.summary: The overall description of an API. Used by Swagger.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.Verb
member.summary: Gets or sets verb to which applies attribute. By default applies to all verbs.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.ParameterType
member.summary: Gets or sets parameter type: It can be only one of the following: path, query, body, model, or header.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets unique name for the parameter. Each name must be unique, even if they are associated with different paramType values.

remarks.para: Other notes on the name field: If paramType is body, the name is used only for UI and codegeneration. If paramType is path, the name field must correspond to the associated path segment from the path field in the api object. If paramType is query, the name field corresponds to the query param name.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the human-readable description for the parameter.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.DataType
member.summary: For path, query, and header paramTypes, this field must be a primitive. For body, this can be a complex or container datatype.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.IsRequired
member.summary: For path, this is always true. Otherwise, this field tells the client whether or not the field must be supplied.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.AllowMultiple
member.summary: For query params, this specifies that a comma-separated list of values can be passed to the API. For path and body types, this field cannot be true.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ApiMemberAttribute.Route
member.summary: Gets or sets route to which applies attribute, matches using StartsWith. By default applies to all routes.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.IApiResponseDescription.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of a response

member.name: P:ServiceStack.IApiResponseDescription.Description
member.summary: The description of a response status code

member.name: T:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute
member.summary: Used to decorate Request DTO's to associate a RESTful request path mapping with a service. Multiple attributes can be applied to each request DTO, to map multiple paths to the service.

summary.para: Initializes an instance of the class.

param.name: path
param.para: The path template to map to the request. See RouteAttribute.Path for details on the correct format.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Initializes an instance of the class.

param.name: path
param.para: The path template to map to the request. See RouteAttribute.Path for details on the correct format.

member.param: A comma-delimited list of HTTP verbs supported by the service. If unspecified, all verbs are assumed to be supported.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path template to be mapped to the request.
member.value: A value providing the path mapped to the request. Never .

remarks.para: Some examples of valid paths are:

Variables are specified within "{}" brackets. Each variable in the path is mapped to the same-named property on the request DTO. At runtime, ServiceStack will parse the request URL, extract the variable values, instantiate the request DTO, and assign the variable values into the corresponding request properties, prior to passing the request DTO to the service object for processing.

It is not necessary to specify all request properties as variables in the path. For unspecified properties, callers may provide values in the query string. For example: the URL "http://services/Inventory?Category=Books&ItemId=12345" causes the same request DTO to be processed as "http://services/Inventory/Books/12345", provided that the paths "/Inventory" (which supports the first URL) and "/Inventory/{Category}/{ItemId}" (which supports the second URL) are both mapped to the request DTO.

Please note that while it is possible to specify property values in the query string, it is generally considered to be less RESTful and less desirable than to specify them as variables in the path. Using the query string to specify property values may also interfere with HTTP caching.

The final variable in the path may contain a "*" suffix to grab all remaining segments in the path portion of the request URL and assign them to a single property on the request DTO. For example, if the path "/Inventory/{ItemPath*}" is mapped to the request DTO, then the request URL "http://services/Inventory/Books/12345" will result in a request DTO whose ItemPath property contains "Books/12345". You may only specify one such variable in the path, and it must be positioned at the end of the path.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.Summary
member.summary: Gets or sets short summary of what the route does.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.Notes
member.summary: Gets or sets longer text to explain the behaviour of the route.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.Verbs
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma-delimited list of HTTP verbs supported by the service, such as "GET,PUT,POST,DELETE".
member.value: A providing a comma-delimited list of HTTP verbs supported by the service, or empty if all verbs are supported.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.RouteAttribute.Priority
member.summary: Used to rank the precedences of route definitions in reverse routing. i.e. Priorities below 0 are auto-generated have less precedence.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.FallbackRouteAttribute
member.summary: Fallback routes have the lowest precedence, i.e. after normal Routes, static files or any matching Catch All Handlers.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.RestrictExtensions.ToAllowedFlagsSet(ServiceStack.RequestAttributes)
member.summary:
Converts from a User intended restriction to a flag with all the allowed attribute flags set, e.g:
If No Network restrictions were specified all Network access types are allowed, e.g: restrict EndpointAttributes.None => ... 111
If a Network restriction was specified, only it will be allowed, e.g: restrict EndpointAttributes.LocalSubnet => ... 010
The returned Enum will have a flag with all the allowed attributes set
